writepity: When girls were making fun of one of my friends at school in a very immature way; I felt pity towards them because I knew that they were only being mean and putting my friends down to feel better about themselves.  The mean girls were making fun of them because they were self conscious about themselves and thought that making fun of other people would make them feel better.  I felt sad to see my friends getting made fun of; but at the same time I felt bad that the mean girls felt the need to do it.  I talked to my friends and convinced them that the mean girls were not worth getting upset about.
writetende: A friend of mine lost one of her best friends in a tragic accident.  Before she lost her friend; we were good friends but not that close.  After she lost her friend; I wanted to be there for her and take care of her.  I went out of my way to make sure she was doing okay and helped her out a lot.  The emotion of tenderness in this situation was my desire to take care of her.
writecomp: Whenever I see homeless people on the street that ask my for money; I feel compassion.  I want to do everything that I can to help them; but I am lost as to what that is most of the time.  I usually offer them money or offer to buy meals for them.
writesymp: A friend of mine was telling me about conflicts that she had been having with her parents that she was very upset about.  I had never experienced the same thing; but I felt really bad for her and wished that it had not happened.  I couldn't relate to what was happening; but still tried to help think of solutions and something to do about it.
writeempat: One of my friends was upset about her future.  She was stressed out and crying about if the major she chose is the right one for her and felt scared because it would be too late to change her major.  Then she was talking about how she wanted to make a difference; have an impact; etc.  This is something that I have felt before.  I also struggled a little bit with choosing my major and being sure that it is the right thing to do.  At the time that it happened to me; I was able to make a pro con list; seriously consider my other options; but then realize that I was just being crazy and saying these things because I was stressed out.  When my friend was telling me how she was feeling; I felt really bad for her because I knew what she was going through and I knew how hard it was to feel like that.  I could relate to how she was feeling.  I tried to ask her the questions that I had also asked myself; and I shared my fears and thought process with her.  I also reassured her that everyone goes through the same thing.
plove: not love
pcontempt: I don't think this is true because pity is more of looking down on someone but realizing why and feeling bad for them.  Contempt is more of not liking someone
tlove: extreme love; like the love a mother has for her child
elove: I would not call empathy a kind of love

writepity: I pity my friend Zach because he is struggling to do what he wants. He went to GVSU for one semester while running track there and hated both the school and track because both were physically and mentally exhausting him. Running 13 miles a day was not good for him. So the next semester he decided to come home and go to a local community college to save money and find direction for a better program for his education. However; in doing this; he lost all of his friends from GVSU; lost a hobby that defined him; and put himself into a very boring and embarrassing situation by admitting defeat at GVSU and transferring to a lesser school. Being at home is boring for him and eats at his self-confidence. Also; he wants to transfer to U of M in the fall; but his GPA was too low at GVSU so he couldn't even apply for that term. He'll have to take another semester at the community college. Also; his parents told him if he came home and went to community college they would buy him a car; and have thus taken that back and have not yet bought him a car. His situation is awful and I pity everything about his life.
writetende: I feel tenderness towards my roommate Emma almost every day. Knowing that she is depressed and very sensitive; I have to walk on eggshells so as to avoid hurting her feelings. It's not easy because sometimes I feel like I could just slap her out of it; but I know that it doesn't work like that. So I take a more tender perspective when I try to talk to her or confront her or help her. I know that I can't be as blunt as I would be with other people and I can't joke around as much either. She is hypersensitive to people that make fun of her so I try to stay away from those kinds of jokes. The tenderness that I feel is towards her feelings; to save her from being more depressed.
writecomp: I felt compassion for my mother when her close friend's husband died. He had cancer for a very long time and was doing very well recovering; but also had other health problems. Eventually he was put into the hospital and given a few days to live; while his comprehension and speech abilities were deteriorating. His family had to watch him die; in the cold hospital; and still manage to be okay for a funeral. My mother; however; would stay with them in the hospital; talk to her friend on the phone for hours; and offer the best advice she could. The situation seemed impossible and I could never imagine being able to stay strong on the phone or in the hospital while someone's life was being destroyed. It was very sad but the compassion I felt for my mother for being such a good support system for her friend.
writesymp: I feel sympathy for my friend Shelby; who lives in the room above me and also has roommate problems. Her roommate Amy is very loud in the mornings; is disrespectful when around her friends; acts very self-absorbed; and is very conceited. Shelby is very nice and doesn't usually confront her; knowing that Amy would just take offense and make it a bigger deal than necessary. I sympathize because I have similar problems with my roommate and other friends and I know that it's not really in her hands to fix.
plove: Pity isn't really a type of love. It's just when you feel bad for someone.
pcontempt: Kind of; because having pity for someone doesn't actually do anything for the situation at all. Most people are probably annoyed to feel pity because it adds an unnecessary sadness to their own life.
tlove: It's a love where you care for someone so you take a caring stance on how you treat them.
clove: I would call it a type of expressing the way you love someone. It is the way that you feel when you do know that you love someone.
slove: Sympathy is a way of showing you care about someone. Not really a type of love.

writecomp: One time one of my friends was incredibly stressed out over school and other parts of life in general.  She came to me to vent out all of her feelings.  She had four exams that week that she had been studying for at least seven hours a day for the past two weeks because she had so much pressure to succeed in all of her classes.  Her parents told her that if she didn't get an a on all of her tests that she was going to be grounded.  I helped her study for the rest of the week and tried to make sure she wasn't panicking too much about it.  She ended up getting a's on all her exams.
writesymp: Earlier this year; my best friend's girlfriend's sister had her sister killed in a car crash.  She and her sister were incredibly close and called each other their best friend.  Both of these girls were known for being very sweet and caring girls.  When I heard the news I immediately started crying.  I couldn't even imagine what it would be like to lose a sister and a best friend; especially in such a tragic and random way.
writeempat: It was a few days in to the track season and we were running our first workout.  I was up front with one of my best friends leading the workout.  Coming around one of the turns he fell to the ground in pain.  He had twisted his leg and ended up tearing a ligament in his knee.  This injury would cause him to miss the entire season as one of our top runners.  I could empathize with the situation because just the year before I had broken my ankle two days before the track season started in the year that I was going to be in the varsity lineup for the first time.
clove: It would be the kind of love that you have for a brother or sister
slove: The sympathy from this situation made me feel very close to the person who I was not particularly close to before.  I felt like the person needed my love
elove: I would not call empathy a kind of love

writepity: I cant recall a single time in my life where I have had empathy for the downtrodden (pity)
writecomp: I remember when I felt compassion for a cat because it was dying. As it died I tried to comfort it because it was coughing up blood and truly needed help that was beyond its reach.
writesymp: I honestly cant remember a single time in my life where i felt sympathy for someone. It has always been an all or nothing between full blown empathy and complete emotional detachment.
writeempat: When I was younger I used to watch a lot of TV. Eventually I noticed that there were certain situations within sitcoms that I could not bare to watch. They always tended towards beings situations in which the protagonist is in a... sketchy... situation. Particularly I remember watching and episode of the Cosby's were Theo had gotten his ear pierced. He had done it without the premission of either of his parents ad illegally as well. He went to his friend's house and essentially had a needle shoved through his ear. As time went on; his ear began to become green and infected and his ability to hide what he had done waned. So it came to a climax where Theo's farther found out what he had done and confronted him. The scene filled me with a sense of heart wrenching shame for Theo as well as a fear for the near future and his well-being.
plove: pity isnt a type of love. In many ways its in direct opposition to love
pcontempt: yup. because both pity and contempt  have their roots in looking  down upon someone
clove: I would not call compassion love
slove: I wouldnt call sympathy a type of love
elove: It would be a love of yourself. You love yourself so much that you allow yourself to experience; and therefore gain hands on knowledge and wisdom from; other people's situation without risking the damages of the situation yourself.

writepity: I felt pity towards my friend who is currently battling a drug addiction and does not see the effects that his addiction causes to other people.  He has been a recreational drug users for years and his parents constantly warn him to stop doing drugs; but he still refused  to listen and wound up in a court ordered rehab center.  I felt bad for him because I knew him before he started using drugs and he was one of my good friends but after he started using he became a completely different person.  I wanted to tell him that he was ruining his life when he was using but I knew that he wouldn't listen or take me seriously.
writetende: I felt a tenderness towards my sister when she did poorly on one of her math tests.  I'm not the best math student by any means; and she generally has a way better grasp on math than I do.  So when she got a score that she typically wouldn't get; I tried to comfort her and let her know that there were going to be plenty more math tests for her to take and that she could bounce back from this one easy.  She seemed to like hearing that; and I was happy that I made her feel a little bit better.
writecomp: A time when I felt compassion towards someone is when they lost a loved one.  It was a really good friend of mine whose grandfather passed away who he was extremely close with.  I felt sorry for what he had to go through and I wanted him to know that I was there in case he needed anything to help comfort him.  He said thank you and he really appreciated it and I felt like I had helped make him feel a little bit better.
writesymp: I felt sympathy towards my friend whose brother passed away from a drug overdose.  We played baseball together for a few years and the family is one of the nicest families I have ever met but the middle brother had a crippling addiction.  One day he disappeared in the middle of the night and his body was found the next morning.  My friend was devastated and I felt like I couldn't do anything to make him feel better.  It was tough ; but the only thing I knew that I could do was to support him in his time of need and be there in case he needed me for anything.
plove: I would not call pity a type of love.
pcontempt: I do not think this is true.
tlove: I would say a tenderness is a gentle type of love.  I honestly don't really know what I mean by that but it sounds good.
clove: I would not say compassion is a type of love.
slove: I feel like sympathy is a love that you feel when you feel sorry for someone.  When you're sympathetic; your heart is reaching out to the other person and that is sort of like what love is.

writepity: 1) When. in high school; a test would a be schedule; a teacher would usually allow a class period for review.  When during this review session I had classmates who would ask questions that were very;very basic I felt pity.  When they asked questions that reflected a complete lack of understanding for the topic at hand I felt badly for them because I realized what a long read they had ahead in learning the material and then applying it on the exam. /  / 2) I felt badly for them; knowing how far they had to go and seemingly how foolish they may have looked to others; asking questions that reflected so poorly on their understanding. /  / 3) I wanted to explain the concepts to them privately if I had the ability; or take it upon myself to make sure they had the knowledge and could apply it properly.  Pity came with a kind of need to remedy the problem myself.
writetende: 1) When I was leaving for college; I had had a boyfriend of almost three years.  We did not discuss our situation going forward until the day before he was supposed to leave for school.  When we did discuss it though; we both cried and agreed that logistically and realistically the only option would be separation; even though we were both very aware of the fact that we still loved each other.  When I saw him start to cry I felt overwhelming tenderness.  I wanted to comfort him and soothe him.  I felt badly for him but did not look down on him in any way. /  / 2) I felt pulled in two directions.  I loved him and currently love him dearly but that didn't and doesn't make me think that we could have had a healthy long distance relationship. /  /  / 3)I both wanted to tell him what he wanted to hear; that we could stay together; but I also knew I couldn't do that because it was a lie.  I didn't think staying together was the correct path for either of us but I desperately wanted to go against that instinct to make him feel better.  So instead I cried with him and we commiserated together about something we could not change. /
writecomp: 1) At a party I attended I was told that there was a girl in the bathroom that needed help.  She was very intoxicated and was vomiting.  The men at the party felt that they could not help her sufficiently. When I entered the bathroom her face was resting on the seat of the toilet and she was dry heaving.  I had never before met this girl; and knew her only through a mutual acquaintance.  I felt very badly for this girl but also wanted to help her; and the two bred compassion. /  / 2) I was disgusted but at the same time realized that I was the only one with the faculties to help her.  She desperately needed help and that made me want to help her. Despite not knowing her; I felt an instinct to help another woman of my age in a bad situation and couldn't turn away knowing it "wasn't my problem". /  / 3) I had to show kindness and tenderness to gain her trust and eventually we got her home.  At that point I could no longer help her because she asked us to leave because she wanted to be alone.  She never thanked me.
writesymp: 1) I was riding on a bus in downtown Los Angeles when I looked out the window and saw a man walking down the street dressed in trash bags from head to toe.  He was shuffling along as the bus passed by and on his face was a look of agonized sorrow that I've never seen.  I felt sympathy because this man was obviously in emotional pain; but I could not understand that pain.  I could not put myself in that situation and did not understand from where his pain was coming.  I desperately wanted to help him but I felt there was nothing I could do.  I think my sense of sympathy was heightened because of the atmosphere on the bus.  On the bus were 50 or so nicely dressed lawyers and clerks from the Los Angeles Criminal Court on their way home from work.  This socioeconomic; psychological; and well-being juxtaposition further made me feel for this man.  Additionally it was a very hot day and there is no way he could have been at a comfortable temperature.  /  / 2) It made me feel almost guilty for having the things I had when this man had nothing.  And I've seen homeless people before but I've never had this type of reaction.  I think it was the fact that the bags didn't even fit him correctly that really sent me into a tailspin.  If he is going to wear bags; shouldn't they at least fit him? Shouldn't he be given that decency? It made me hyper-conscious of the inequality of the standard of living experience by people in the same country; in the same state and city.   /  / 3) I felt powerless to help him; like he was just caught in this viscous machine.  There are currently and have been in the past a great number people who have dedicated their lives to trying to solve this issue and have not been successful.  Despite how badly I wanted to help hi; I knew there was nothing I could personally do and it made me even more sympathetic because he seemed caught and without chance of help.  So I watched him trudge for as long as I could before the bus turned a corner.  And then I fought back tears.
writeempat: 1) When I watch sports I always feel empathy for the losing team; especially toward the player on whose play the game ends.  They probably feel badly about themselves; and when I have been in that position; I have felt badly about myself.  /  / 2) I understood their situation by means of having experienced it before.  There is a pit in one's stomach and a feeling of guilt that only failure can elicit.  Even in a team sport; if you are the last out; or miss the last shot; or miss the last field goal; the energy of the loss seems to revolve around your actions.  It's a horrible feeling and the loss weighs heavily. /  / 3) I always want to tell the team that lost that sometime in the future they will be the winners.  Granted when I 'm the one losing that's not what I want to hear.  When I'm the loser I want to hear that it's not my fault and that some other factor caused me and/or the team to preform badly.
plove: I do not think it's a type of love.
pcontempt: I think there can be an element of contempt.  Akin indicates an equality that I think does not exist in this relationship.
tlove: In this case it was a kind of love.  It was an emotional connection to the person and the situation.
clove: I would not call it love.
slove: I would not consider sympathy a kind of love.
elove: I do not think it is a type of love.

writepity: In China; everyone needs to take a entrance exam to get into college. But different with the SAT in America; people can take the exam only one time. Due to large population and limited good schools; the competition is very intense and a lot of people can't go to their dream schools. One of my friends; who scored one point away from the school he wanted to go to made me feel pity about him. At the same time; I felt sad and useless. I knew I couldn't do anything about it but I thought he should have gone to his dream school. He was so close. So I talked to him; said sorry and invited him to hang out with me in order to make him happier.
writetende: The moment I felt tenderness was when I was spending time with one of my best friends. She just broke up with his boyfriend whom she had been with for nearly five years. We went out with other friends for Karaoke and as she was singing a love song with tremble voices; I felt that something softest in my heart was touched. I didn't feel sympathy for her; but the feeling was resulted from her sadness and despair. I knew I had to do something about it and I wanted to help her. I sat down besides her and hugged her as she began crying. We have been close friends for more than six years and until today; I still remember the feeling of that moment.
writecomp: I remember one of the formally famous singers in China was caught taking drugs. The scandal spread quickly and soon he disappeared on all kinds of TV and magazines. After nearly ten years; he finally came back to the stage and said:" The only thing that kept me strong the past ten years was that I still love singing and I want to sing for all of you. Thank you so much for letting me on the stage again." And at that point; I felt compassion for him. I wanted to forgive him for all he did and the bad influence he had on the society. I thought I could understand his urge and his pain. I was at the same time very happy to see him back on the stage again and win over those drugs.
writeempat: I don't think I remember anything special about empathy. But I do have the feeling of not interested and wanted to get out of the situation when I think about the word.
plove: a love of kindness
pcontempt: No true for me. I don't look down on people who have worked hard but just missed the one chance to succeed.
tlove: a kind of love that touches people and promote the desire to protect a close person.
clove: A love that is generous
elove: I don't call empathy a kind of love.

writepity: When my little brother wasn't getting the playing time he deserved on the basketball team; I felt pity for him. If he weren't good enough to be playing; I wouldn't feel that at all; but since the coaches weren't treating him fairly; I really felt pity for him .
writetende: I was home for spring break with 13 of my friends a few weeks ago. Just 3 weeks prior to getting home for break; one of my two dogs passed away. Of course I was upset; but the emotion my mother was going through was brutal. On the Friday of spring break; my friends left and I had two days to spend just with my family. My mom was just getting over the loss of our first dog Otis when my dad got back from the Vet with my second dog. When my mom asked how she was; my dad bluntly responded; "we need to talk." They went into my dad's office and within a matter of seconds I heard my mom screaming and crying. Bella; now my only dog; was just diagnosed with lung cancer and was given less than a month to live. That month only lasted two days as she passed away just hours as I came back to school on Sunday. I loved my dogs and was very upset; but mom did everything for these dogs and I could only feel tenderness for her as she lost her two best friend and hiking buddies in a matter of weeks.
writecomp: It was our football banquet senior year of high school. I was never to play a game again. When my coach began to talk about me; he couldn't even finish what he was saying before tears came to his eyes. When I went up to talk about him; I wanted to tell him to tell him that whatever he thought I did for him; he did 1000x more for me and I am extremely grateful for him. Unfortunately; before I could even get those words out; I started bawling my eyes; knowing that I was never going to play for him again. In this moment; I felt true compassion for my football coach.
writesymp: My older brother never scored a touchdown in high school football career. In our second to last game; he had a perfect opportunity to do; only to drop a touchdown in the endzone. This had no impact on the outcome of the game; but as his little brother; all I wanted was for him to catch just one touchdown pass. I still feel sympathy in my head every time I picture him dropping that pass.
writeempat: I was in 8th grade on my way to a football game when our bus drove by a car accident. The two kids in front of me were looking and laughing when my coach turned around and said; "yeah; you guys laugh but imagine that family is going through right now." I was always taught that empathy is putting yourself in someone else's shoes and in this situation I put myself in the shoes of this family who could have been dealing with a relative who got either seriously injured or killed in this brutal car accident.
plove: Wouldn't put these together.
pcontempt: Don't know what that means
tlove: I was not referring to tenderness as love in this situation
clove: The compassion I felt for my football coaches was definitely a love for them as well.
slove: I would not cal sympathy love here; except for the fact that I felt sympathy for someone that I loved.
elove: Not connected in this situation

writepity: Not too long ago; my roommate left to go to a dinner with her charity group downtown. She left the apartment very enthusiastically and I expected her to not return for several hours. Within 45 minutes; however; she came back. It was easy to see her anxiety levels were extremely high. She told me that there were just too many people in the restaurant and she couldn't get herself to talk to any of them and that when she walked in and saw them; she immediately left (knowing that everyone saw her as well). I knew that my roommate was shy; but I didn't think it would hold her back from doing activities that she loved! I felt horrible for her; a sort of pity. I tried to talk to her about it; but she was so worked up that she immediately went to her room and stayed there for the rest of the night.
writetende: When I first met cousin; just after he was born; I immediately felt tenderness towards him. Because he was so little and fragile; I immediately dropped all of the tension in my body (and mind) in order to hold and interact with him. I felt relaxed; at ease; and loving as soon as I held him. Most newborn babies are at a stage where they need to feel loved and wanted and cared for and it seems that many women carry this sort of tenderly instinct in them; so this occurred quite naturally to me.
writecomp: When my fiance and I got engaged back in December; I felt compassion. When he proposed to me; it was the most pleasantly overwhelming feeling. I knew that in that moment that I said yes; I was completely devoted towards him. I wanted him to be in my life forever; and the sense of love and affection that I feel when I think of him makes me want to work hard to be the one that he always wants.
writesymp: A while ago; my best friend's grandpa passed away. I went to the funeral and saw her there crying. I immediately felt sympathy. A couple years before that; my great grandmother passed away; and she was there trying to comfort me during the funeral. Now; it was me who was comforting her. I feel that considering once a person experiences something; and in then comes in contact with another person experiencing the same situation; they are more than likely to feel sympathy. I knew what my friend was going through; so I felt that my caring and patient side began to show. In order to calm her; I talked to her about things that she wanted to talk about at the time; letting her express her grief or distract herself in anyway she chose.
plove: If I were to call pity a kind of love; then it would be a more concerning love in that when I think of pity; I think of people feeling concern for those they care about.
pcontempt: I don't think so because at that moment; I really didn't feel any contempt as much as I did worry.
tlove: If I were to call tenderness a kind of love; then it would be an affectionate and caring kind of love because I feel that tenderness is a sort of way of taking care of another.
clove: If I were to call compassion a kind of love; it would be an affectionate and devoted kind of love because when I think of compassion; I think of someone being devoted to another person.
slove: I feel that sympathy could be considered a kind of love; and it would be a emotional and caring kind of love because like pity; you feel a sense of concern towards another; and you want to be able to help them in anyway.

writepity: A rival high school has always had the better football out of the two schools. But we knew that we had better academics; in a way; we pitied this of them. We thought they were stupid when they would celebrate a win even though they probably knew they were going to win. I felt bad that they had only high school football to cheer about.
writetende: My roommate had just lost a close friend and I knew that I had to be a good friend and be very nice to him because he was in vulnerable spot in life.  I had to be very nice; ask him if he was okay; and ask him what i could do. Most of all; all i could really say was im sorry.
writecomp: My buddy had just gotten out of the water of his best race. He had finished second in the state but he crushed his best time but all he could think about with his second place. I felt that he was wrong and should worry only about the time but I could see that he was hurt so I gave him a hug of compassion.
writesymp: My friend; Tyler; had been my training partner for most of my childhood. He could compete with me in practice but was never able to do very well in meets like I could. At the end of his career; I was moving on to the next level and he was to be done with the sport. At this point; I felt some sympathy towards him; I felt that he deserved more because he worked hard throughout the whole training process but it never clicked at the meets. I felt sorry for him in a way that he deserved to be successful as much as I was. I really wanted for him to do well but at the end all i could tell him was; good swims; get 'em next time out.
writeempat: Alabama always has the best football team in the country. They get all the best recruits; the run the best offense; they have the best defense. I wish our team could be like their team.
plove: pity is not love
pcontempt: No; with pity; I feel bad for the person or group and i dont like them.
tlove: tenderness is love; if the person you are being tender with is a loved one
clove: compassion is not love
slove: sympathy is not love
elove: empathy is not love

writepity: On the last day of my Alternative Spring Break trip; our group had our mattresses layed out in a circle (our heads all facing each other) so that we could see each other and reflect about the day. We talked about the amazing relationships we made on the trip; and the amazing relationships we made with each other. Towards the end of the reflection; one of the girls started talking by saying "On a more serious note..." right at that moment I knew she was going to apologize about the way she was acting on the trip. Throughout the trip she was very bossy; stingy; and seemed to always have her own opinion about everything. She was our site leader for the trip; but didn't treat us like equals; she treated us like children. As she made her apology and talked about how she wishes she became closer to some of us and was less stressed throughout the trip. Then she started shaking as she said "Something you all don't know about me is..." then she stuttered; said "um" multiple times and it was clear that she was extremely uncomfortable about what she was about to say. Then the words came out and she told us how ever since 7th grade; she has attempted to commit suicide 3 times; and last year her roommate caught her/took her to the hospital. She told us that the past monday while we were on the trip; she had those similar thoughts again. As she told us this my hand immediately went over my mouth and I started crying. I cried so much as she told me that I couldnt even see her face. After she was done; we all simultaneously got up and surrounded her in a group embrace as she sat there shaking and crying. We were all around her silently crying for over 30 minutes. Just being next to her; and being near everyone else who now is aware of her problem; made us feel closer than ever before.
writetende: I felt tenderness towards my dance team when we had our final competition together because I have spent so many long nights practicing with them and becoming a tight knit family that this last moment on stage was one that we will never forget. We all built each other up on stage; cheered for each other; and gave it our all. I wanted to never leave them; but I knew that after this competition we wouldnt be seeing as much of each other as we used to. I still think of them as my family here on campus though; and I believe that the tenderness is something you feel for family members.
writecomp: Whenever I saw my parents for the first time in a while when I first started college I would hug them and tears would start streaming because of how much I love them; and love that they are here for me. I miss them so much and when I have them here with me I feel that I never want to let them out of my sight because I don't know if they are unhappy or happy about me being so far away.
writesymp: I felt sympathy towards our family friend's when their mother passed away. I was a freshman in high school and I remember just feeling awful about the situation because of how important the mother was in our community. She was also very close to my parents so I respectfully wished the family well and was there for them. I didnt have many words to say because I didn't understand what they were going through at all. All I could do was hug them as much as possible
writeempat: I felt empathy for my best friend when she told me about her break up with a long term boyfriend. She seemed quite uncomfortable about the situtation/ talking about which I understood because I couldn't talk about my break up for a long time. I felt a lot of pain coming from her; and I felt that she was going through a hard time because she still loved this person and was hoping to make it work. However; I encouraged her to keep seeing her friends and cling on to the bad aspects of the relationship to help her get over him quickly. She called me; so I wasnt able to give her any physical hug or assurance; but all I could do was tell her that it will be okay in the end and this will be a good thing for her.
plove: It's more about the love that comes from you when you pity is the kind of love that one has when they need to take care of someone.
pcontempt: Not exactly sure
tlove: I felt tenderness to my teammates because I love them so much and never want to see them sad.
clove: Compassion is the kind of love you feel when you that person makes you feel better; or makes you a better person
elove: It's understanding a close friend and sending your love to them so they can heal.

writepity: When I saw a old beggar with disability on the streets I would pity them. I feel like there is nothing much I can do to change their situation and that their situation will not change easily or any time soon.  /  / I wouldn't do anything because we were taught to not give money to beggar; since it was found in the recent years that there are illegal organization kidnapping kids vulnerable old people; hurting them and make them beg on the streets and the organization would earn money out of them.  /  / I would walk away faster because I could not bear to look at them and I feel heartless when I do nothing.
writetende: I feel tenderness when I see a very soft new born baby. I feel like they are very vulnerable and fragile and delicate beings that I need to treat with a lot of love and care. I have my best wishes for them. When I see the baby I would like to be given the opportunity to express love towards her and maybe given the change to kiss and hug and touch her
writecomp: Compassion is the sympathy /pity you have for someone but if you are feeling compassionate; you will have an urge to help those people out. For example when I was reading about how young kids in China are deprived or are eventually forced to give up on education because there are inadequate resources and because that the schools are simply too far; I feel bad for them and I also would want to do something because I know I can to help them; for example go on service trips to be teachers or build schools; or as simple as donating money. /  /  I feel like I wanted them to enjoy what I am having (quality education) now because it should be a right for everyone to be able to learn. I know that through education; we will have a "brighter" future and I feel like they should be given the same opportunity to grow; I just really wanted them to experience what I was having because I know it would be good for them; and that they will feel happy for getting it /
writesymp: When someone is very sad because a family of his is sad; I would feel sympathy towards him; feel bad for him. / I would say like "stay strong"; "good luck" but I do not feel I can do anything about it.
writeempat: When my friend's granny passed away I felt empathy towards her because I know how sad she would feel as my grandpa passed away not long ago too and it was painful. I want to share with her my experience so that she could not feel as sad; but somehow I want to linger in that sad emotion with her too because the heartache makes me recall the time I had with my very close grandpa; I hate to feel that I can forget about him. /  / I think I feel empathy as well as the emotion the person I expressed empathy towards at the same time; despite feeling empathy for that person; I feel like I was also very immerged in my own personal emotion
plove: No it's not a kind of love
pcontempt: somewhat; you do not have to be dishonored to have someone to feel pity for you; as long as you are not in as situation as good as someone else; someone else can feel pity towards you
tlove: It is a kind of unconditional love. You cannot really control to not express that love.
cfeltother: 1. sad/feel bad for them / 2. thankful I was not in that situation / 3.
clove: It would be love with a constraint; you usually express compassion towards people you do not know well and you really want them to be in a better situation; but you would not hesitate to feel that kind of "love" because except than feeling that emotion; you are not really required to have follow-up action for it
sfeltother: 1. Sad for what happened / 2. wish them well / 3.
slove: It is a kind of love; because you want them to get better and you want them to know that you care.
elove: It is a kind of love; you care; you want them to feel better; and I want to contribute a lot to make them feel better

writepity: In high school I met a very nice girl who was 2 grades above me. We were never that close yet we became friends through being on the same Science Olympiad team. As the years passed she entered university in Rhode Island and I was still in high school. One day she got a boyfriend and her happy pictures she took with him filled up my facebook wall. She looked so happy and I was happy for her. But recently; only a few months ago; her boyfriend went missing. He went on a kayaking and hunting trip and did not return home. There was a huge search and rescue mission to find him but they could not for 2 weeks. Eventually they found his body; he was dead. I felt so sad and worried for my friend. The pain she must have felt; I felt bad for her. I wanted to give her my condolences but as we were never really that close and grew even further apart in recent years I did not feel like I had a good way of telling her how I felt. I pitied her as I would hope to not have to experience that sort of pain. I hoped someone close to her would be able to comfort her.
writetende: I met a boy in middle school that was always very kind to me in my darkest moments. He was always there to talk to me even though i was one of the shyest students in the grade. I rarely ever initiated conversations with others yet he would always talk to me and make me feel more comfortable about the situation and about myself. I slowly felt this tenderness towards him. I felt like I understood his character and I really liked it. I wanted deeply to be closer as friends. I was always kind to him and he always returned the kindness.
writecomp: I felt compassion towards people I met in the hospital I volunteered at. I never met them before and rarely was able to meet with the same people each week but I felt like I had to do my best to help them out. They were all cancer patients and in need of assistance that I wanted to provide them. I felt compelled to actively help them out. I felt bad for them but at the same time a bit hopeful that they would be able to recover. I was able to talk to some of them and help make their day a little more bearable.
writesymp: When my mom went ice skating when she was younger she fell and knocked out one of her front teeth. I felt bad for her. I had never had that happen to me but I felt so sad for her. I could not image how horrified I would be if that happened to me. But I am also happy that she got over it and moved on. I could not directly relate to the situation but could still place myself in her shoes and imagine how I would have felt.
writeempat: I heard that some of my friends were self harming themselves. They had body image issues and were feeling down. I felt empathy towards them as I have self-harmed in the past and understood perhaps where those feelings were coming from. I also suffer from body image issues. I felt bad for them in a bit of a deeper level as I could understand where the root of the cutting came from. But I also felt a bit angry and annoyed as I knew they were also doing it for attention. They would post pictures and try to get comments of sympathy. I knew that their reasons for self-harm were not exactly the same as mine. They were not rooted in the same kind of depression as mine. I comforted my friends and helped them stop the self-harm. I tried to comfort them. But inside I still felt annoyed at the situation.
plove: I would not call pity a kind of love. I think pity is more of a type of compassion (though I believe there are other types of compassion).
pcontempt: I do not think this is always true. I believe that pity can drive people to actively help others; but often it is seen as something passing. It is often the acceptance of an unfortunate event out of the victim's control (or hard to control).
tlove: I do not think tenderness is a type of love. I believe it can lead to love but does not always lead to it. It is something I believe love should have; but it is not a type of love itself.
clove: I do not think compassion is a type of love; but something that should be present in love.
slove: I would not call sympathy a kind of love.
elove: I do not think empathy is a type of love but something that can come out of love.

writepity: During my senior year of high school; two of my best friends mom's were diagnosed with cancer. For my friend Lexi's mom; the cancer had returned after 10 years. For my friend Julie's mom; it was the first time she was ever diagnosed with cancer. However; I sympathized with them. I did not pity them. When you look down upon someone with pity; it suggests that you will never be in their place. People often pity others when they lose someone or they pity homeless people. How do you know you will never be in their place. In my opinion; pity is a judgement that is unnecessary. As a result; I sympathized with my friends because maybe one day my mom will get cancer. I showed compassion. I helped out when they needed it and tried to help them have a fun senior year. Who knows where I will be five or ten years from now. It is not my place to pity others. I would not want to be pitied if I was in their position.
writetende: Tenderness is kind of a vague emotion and can be applicable to many different kinds of people. One of the times I felt tenderness was when my 5th teacher had a heart attack. She was an incredible teacher and I was worried about how she would recover. Although she was not still my teacher when she had her heart attack; I was concerned for her safety.
writecomp: My younger sister is extremely prone to injury. In the past two years alone; she broke her foot twice and she broke her arm. She has become increasingly angry and frustrated. All she wants to do is be active. She wants to play soccer and basketball and she wants to run track but; her injuries keep getting in the way. I want to help her achieve her goals but sometimes her body will not let her. I try to encourage her to build up her strength by doing different exercise but at times it is hard. Her body is very weak.
writeempat: Right before Nationals for Irish dancing; one of my really good friends tore her ACL. A seriously invasive surgery ensued. I empathized with her because I had done the exact same thing before. Tearing an Acl and having to go through the surgical process can be extremely taxing and frustrating. I understood what she was going through.
plove: I would not call pity love. To pity someone is to belittle them and that is not love.
pcontempt: In certain ways yes. I thing pity is a way of looking down upon someone. In this situation; you are above them or superior to them.
tlove: Tenderness is a step above kindness in my point of view. When you feel tenderness towards someone you do not exactly love them but you appreciate them.
clove: Compassion is one of the greatest types of love. It is without judgement or superiority. With compassion you accept someone just the way they are and hope that things get better for them. Often; you even try to ease their difficulties or their pain.
elove: In order to empathize with someone; you have to go through the same thing as them or something similar. It is a type of love where you share your anger; frustration and your sadness.

writepity: My best friend cheated on her boyfriend with another boy. Her old boyfriend was one of my good friends too and this was not one of the first times that she had committed such an act. This was almost like the straw that broke the camels back. She lost me as a friend. I couldn't be friends with someone who I thought was not loyal. However; she also lost a lot of her friends as well. I pitied her because she lost all of her friends and had no one to turn to. She was all alone. The reason I pitied her though was because it was all her fault; repercussions from her actions.
writetende: My friend had just broken up with her long time boyfriend. She called me right after it happened in hysterics. She was barely able to speak because she was crying so much. Between her tears and her heavy breathing; I could not hear what she was saying. Over the phone; I tried calming her down with little remarks such as "it is going to be okay" or just telling her to breathe. I felt extremely sad for her and did not understand what had happened. Questions ran through my head such as "why did he break things off with her" and "is she going to be okay". I went over to her house where we cooked chocolate chip pancakes and watched our favorite TV show One Tree Hill. I wanted to take her mind off of him and the situation; which worked. Occasionally; she would start crying; in which case I moved close to her and hugged her; letting her know I was there for her.
writecomp: I felt compassion towards my friends when they tried really hard to make my birthday special this year. Usually; I hate my birthday and the attention that comes with it. However; this year my friends made sure that I had a great birthday. They showered me with love and fun activities. I was so thankful and felt so lucky to have them as friends. I told them how special they made my birthday and I even cried out of happiness and love for them.
writeempat: In 10th grade; my classmates and I had to take physics. I really struggled throughout the year. I got D's on all of my tests and just could not grasp the material. It was very hard for me to do so poorly in a class. My friend who was a year younger than me in school took physics when she was in 10th grade as well. Having survived the course; I helped her when she was struggling. The first test she got a 40% on. I told her that it was going to be okay. She could improve in the course and that it was only the first test. Also; there were other forms of assessments that she could do well on.
plove: Pity is not love. Pity is looking down upon someone that you feel sorry for.
pcontempt: Yes. I think when you pity someone it is because you feel sorry for them and you are angry at them.
tlove: I think tenderness is affection for another person; both romantically or platonic. When you love someone and they are suffering; you use tenderness to help the situation.
clove: Compassion is a romantic and friendly love. You feel compassion towards people that you truly are close with and love to be around.
elove: I usually empathize with people that have been in similar situations as me. Usually; they are people that I love but not always.

writepity: Recently; a friend of mine cut her toe extremely badly on accident. For the next few days; she was complaining about how much it hurt and how she probably should have gotten stitches; but she could no longer because it was too late. While I felt bad for how much pain she was in; she should have taken herself to the doctor and gotten it fixed. It was hard for her to walk for the next few days; and it became obvious that she should go to the doctor. While I felt bad for her; she also did not help herself by not going to the doctor. It could get worse in the future; and she would regret not taking action right when it happened.
writetende: I felt tenderness when a family friend recently had a baby. As we went to their house to meet the newborn; my family and I acted with tenderness toward the baby and toward the parents. The baby was new to this world; and we knew that it would not be good to overwhelm her. We just acted calmly; rather than being extremely rambunctious. We also wanted to be tender toward the mother; as she had just gone through many hours of birth. She was exhausted; and overwhelming her with our presence would not have helped her situation.
writesymp: My roommate is one of the hardest working individuals I have ever met. She stays up until about 2 AM every night for a week before she has a test; and does everything necessary in order to do well. Her test grade came; and she did not do nearly as well as she had expected. I felt a large amount of sympathy for her because she worked much harder than many other people; and she did not do nearly as well as she had expected. There was really not much I could do. Even though I told her she did everything she could to do well; she did not feel that way. I tried to cheer her up and let her know that there are other tests in the class that she can do well on.
writeempat: A friend of mine struggled with her family as her dad was having issues with alcohol. This was a similar experience to me; as my dad also suffered from alcoholism. The disease can affect one's entire family very quickly. Her dad was having issues at work; just as mine was; and the two decided that the only way they could feel better was by consuming large amounts of alcohol. In her experience; this was all she could think about and was having a hard time focusing on her schoolwork. The only thing that I could do was talk to her about it; but I told her what happened in my experience and how I dealt with it. I felt empathy with her because I truly put myself in her shoes and tried to help her as much as possible. I felt empathy for my friend because I knew exactly what she was going through and how hard it must have been for her; so I wanted to let her know that I had dealt with a similar issue before. I wanted to let her know that even though it is a hard situation to be in; I had gone through a similar experience and I could show her that it was all going to be okay.
plove: I do not call pity a kind of love.
pcontempt: I think this is slightly true. While I may feel pity toward someone; I am not always feeling contempt also. I feel that contempt is much stronger than pity.
tlove: I would not call tenderness a kind of love.
slove: I would not call sympathy a kind of love.
elove: I would not call empathy a kind of love.

writepity: One example of pity that comes to mind; that a lot of people might have; especially in Ann Arbor; would be pertaining to homeless people. There are usually a lot of homeless people that hang out on the north end of State Street in all seasons. One of the first days I was here in Ann Arbor; I was walking with friends down State St. to go shopping. It was a hot day so there were a lot of homeless people on the street at that time. They would ask people for money as they walked by or just try to talk to them. I couldn't help but feel pity for them in their situation. In my hometown; there are not many homeless people but my parents raised me to not treat them as anything less and if they needed help; we could help however we could. So that day on State St; I pulled some ones out of my wallet and handed it to a man as I walked by. I guess I did this out of pity. However; my friends looked at me and questioned why I had done that and said that he was just going to buy drugs. I didn't really care what he did with the money; he needed it more than I did. I still see homeless people on the streets of Ann Arbor; but not always do I have money to spare. But there is still pity that comes to mind when I walk past them.
writetende: In this particular story; I used tenderness as well as compassion and sympathy; and some empathy towards someone. One of my best friends; Alissa; that I met here at school lives right across the hall from me and is roommates with my other best friend. We all knew something was wrong when Alissa wasn't replying in our group text message. When I heard her come home; I knocked on the door and she opened; tears filling her eyes. I walked her to her bed and we sat down and she just put her head on my shoulders as she told me that her grandfather had just passed away. Alissa was extremely close with her grandfather. She always talked about him and every time she went home; she would see him (they did not live far apart). I could see how incredibly sad she was over this. In these situations; it is hard to comfort someone because of how much pain they are in. There are no words that someone can say to make that pain go away. So; I let her cry on my shoulder as I rubbed her arms. We sat in silence with just the sound of her slight crying and she knew that I was there for her in any way that I could be. To use the word; I was trying to be as tender as possible with her because of her frailness of heart at the time. Eventually she stopped crying and we moved forward. She still sometimes needs to talk about it and I am always there for her.
writeempat: It is a smaller situation but goes along with empathy. I was at a party the other week with my sorority. A girl in the grade above me came up to a few of us girls in my grade that were dancing and said; "Hey girls! Never; ever get into a relationship in college. Don't do it it's a bad idea." I knew that this girl had had a serious boyfriend for a long time that she knew from home. He was now at the University in my grade. I went up to her and asked her if she had broken up with him and she said yeah and that she found out that he cheated on her a long time ago. I quickly gave her a hug and I explained that I had also been cheated on by a long term boyfriend. I told her that it is one of the worst feelings and when you find out there are so many emotions that run through your head. I also tried to explain that now that she is away from that guy; she can have a fun time in college and hang out with her friends more and meet new people. She said that she wasn't as that point yet; and I understood. I told her that it would come; without a doubt. I had been through this situation and that is was gave me empathy for her situation.
plove: I do not think pity is love.
pcontempt: Just slightly because I do not think that pity is a good emotion. I don't think that is a kind emotion nor is contempt.
tlove: It would be a kind of love between loved ones. Not necessarily intimate relationships but also between family members and friends who you love very much.
elove: Empathy is love for people that you can connect with over a certain situation. You can connect with strangers because of a similar situation you have and this is love.

writetende: My girlfriend was having a hard time in college and because we are in a long distance relationship it added more stress. When she came to visit me last semester; I felt tenderness towards her. I wanted her to have a good weekend and I wanted to help relieve any stress from school or the lack of communication/seeing each other as often as before.
writecomp: I felt compassion for my brothers who had rough times in high school and college. Being the youngest I had to learn from their mistakes but also as their brother I knew I had to be there for them. It was difficult to be there for them because I was the youngest and sometimes they wouldn't listen to me. I wanted to give them my advice as a witness as what was happening but many times it was to no avail. I didn't give up though and continued to show compassion towards them and in the end they appreciated it.
tlove: It would be a love not of marriage; but a love dealing with compassion. I felt like I had the responsibility to take care of her in this situation and because of this I had respect for her; felt comfortable around her; and had compassion towards her.

writepity: My twin brother always had much more trouble in high school than  I did; not because he wasn't as intelligent; but because he never took his grades as seriously. Eventually; he got his act together and made it into a very good university; but for a while it seemed like no colleges would accept him. Our parents would berate him and he kept comparing himself to the people he knew that would get better grades than him. I remember pitying him; because I couldn't even imagine how he was feeling. I didn't feel sympathy as much; because he got himself in the situation. I just pitied him for not coming to the realization sooner that he needed to step his game up; school-wise. I often looked down on him as someone who needed help and couldn't make things better himself. I feel like condescension is often accompanied by pity. I would constantly try to motivate him to do better in school; even getting angry at him when he wouldn't study; because he needed to take care of himself.
writecomp: I have a friend who broke up with her boyfriend of about a year; and she took it really hard. None of her friends; including me; approved of how he treated her; but she still cared deeply about him. After they broke up; I was very happy she was out of the toxic relationship; but I tried to hide my happiness and attempted to be compassionate instead. I listened to her talk about how much she missed him and gave her a shoulder to cry on. I felt sorry for her; but I didn't pity her. I just wanted her to feel better; so I put my true feelings aside in order to help her feel better.
writesymp: I'm friends on Facebook with a girl I knew in high school; and she recently had a miscarriage. She posted about it on the site and seemed very saddened by it. She was looking forward to having a child; and then suddenly she didn't have the chance anymore. I didn't know this girl very well; but I did feel sympathy for her. I can't possibly ever imagine what it would feel like to lose your unborn child; I just know it would be tragic. I sent my condolences out top her; but that was all I could do.
writeempat: I have a friend who auditioned for the theater school twice; and got rejected both times. In between rejections; she also didn't get cast in any of the full-length shows she auditioned for; and got nothing but small parts in the smaller shows she was in. She felt very down in the dumps; and I felt a large amount of empathy towards her. I know what it feels like to be rejected and to feel like you're not good enough. I've experienced those things; so I knew exactly how she was feeling and how to best console her. I related my experiences to hers and told her how I came out of it stronger in order to help her do the same.
plove: I wouldn't call pity a type of love; I'd say that it stems from feeling love towards a person.
pcontempt: I feel like if you can pity someone; you also tend to feel condescending towards something. I definitely think feeling above someone can provide a feeling of contempt.
clove: I would call compassion a very tender type of love. Something you feel towards people you are close to.
slove: I'd say sympathy is a lot like empathy; in that it's a type of love that comes out in difficult situations. I'd say it's not as strong as empathy; because you can't connect as well.
elove: I was be the kind of love that comes through in difficult situations; where you're trying to console someone.

writecomp: When my boyfriend and i were walking to lunch one day; there was a homeless man asking for change. I felt sorry for him; but in a distant kind of way. Still; i felt compelled to help him so we gave him some change. He just said thank you with a big smile; and i felt very glad that we could help contribute to his momentary happiness.
writesymp: The other day in my English class when we were getting our graded essays back; there was one girl who got a D+ on her essay. She was so distraught because she thought she put in so much time and effort and that she was going to get a good grade. I felt bad for her because i have obviously been there at one point or another in my academic career. Everyone has. So even though I felt bad; i tried to relate to her that it isn't the end of the world and with extra credit; she should still be able to get a decent grade in the class. Even though I didn't directly feel her pain and shame in that moment; i still understood the pain because i have been there before.
writeempat: Earlier in the semester; a kid in my dorm killed himself. I din't know him and it was the first time i even heard his name. I guess I didn't even have a reason to be upset but i cried for hours thinking about the kid's family. I felt their pain so directly; as if it were my own pain. I didn't really want to to or say anything besides call my family members and tell them how much i loved them; which i did later that evening. It was only too easy to put myself in their shoes; so this is how i felt directly empathetic to them.
clove: I would probably call it sacrificial love. Although you may not fully understand the person's pain; you give up something of yours whether it be time; money or friendship; you sacrifice something to better someone else's situation.
slove: Sympathy is a very understanding love. You don't have to directly subject yourselves to the person's emotions or give anything up. You just understand where they are coming from most likely because you have been there yourself. You don't always feel inclined to help that person; you just acknowledge that their pain is justified.
elove: I would probably venture to call empathy a sort of brotherly love. You take on someone's emotions in the purest form without thinking of yourself in that moment.

writepity: My best friend Gabe has Chrohn's disease; and due to a lot of stress at school with teachers and work; he had to go to the hospital.  The stress had caused problems with his intestines.  We didn't think it was bad at first; but he ended up having to stay in the hospital for about six months; and having to undergo three surgeries.  I visited him as many times as I could.  I felt so bad for him; and thus I felt so much pity for him and his situation.  All I wanted was for him to get better.  I knew he was sad because he just wanted to be back at school too.
writetende: When my best friend; Hannah; broke up with her boyfriend; I felt tenderness towards her.  She called me crying; explaining the situation.  She said they hadn't gotten into a fight; but her and her boyfriend were just not working out like she thought they would be.  They had so many similarities; but it wasn't a perfect match.  Hannah wanted to break up with him because she didn't want to be in a relationship anymore with him. Although she thought he was so perfect; she didn't want to be with him.  She was crying and trying to explain her emotions.  I was trying to understand her feelings; the entire time feeling tenderness toward her and the situation.  I never wanted to see her sad; so I went to pick her up and took her to get ice cream and talk to me to make her feel better.  I kept telling her that it wasn't her fault; and some things just aren't meant to be.  Also; I said they could hopefully stay friends and talk about the things they had in common; but now she knows that he was not the type she was looking for.
writecomp: When I participated in Dance Marathon; an event in which people had to stand for 30 hours; I felt annoyed; depressed; sad; angry; and bored.  I didn't know what to do with all that time; and I was extremely exhausted.  Even though I had some of my close friends by my side; I still felt so sad and mad that I decided to participate.  I was texting my best friend; Leila; for the majority of the time; explaining to her how I felt.  She kept telling me that I should leave; and she would come pick me up if I wanted; but I felt an obligation to stay; despite how awful I was feeling.  I even broke down crying at one point; and called Leila; who told me everything was going to be okay and that I had the option to leave if I wanted to; and that if I stayed then I had the strength to do so; and the support of her and my other friends at the event.  Unexpectedly; at about 3:00AM; Leila showed up with our friend; Jake; and my favorite late night food; pizza.  The amount of happiness I felt when I saw she came; especially at that hour; was overwhelming.  And the fact that she was so thoughtful to bring me my favorite food made me feel so compassionate towards her.  She was so caring to think about me and my feelings; and I was so happy.  She made me feel so much better; and I felt that I had to complete the marathon because of what she had done for me.
writesymp: One time; I was running some errands; so I missed out on my brother's basketball game.  He had really wanted me to come to the game; and my parent said he was sad that I couldn't make it.  I felt sympathetic because I had wanted to come and I knew he had wanted me to come; but I wasn't able to make it.  I was sad I couldn't go; and sad that my brother was upset I couldn't  go.
writeempat: In my opinion; empathy is the understanding of another's feelings.  My friend; Ashley; failed one of the AP European History tests in high school.  I had also failed the test.  When I failed the test; I felt so awful.  I cried; and kept wondering why I didn't do better or how this could have happened if I studied so much.  I wanted to drop the class; but I also wanted to find out what I could do better in terms of study techniques for the next time.  When Ashley told me she failed the test; I knew exactly how she felt because the same thing had happened to me.  She felt sad and I was empathetic because I understood her feelings and I felt the same way.
plove: I think pity is feeling sad for someone else and their situation.  In a way; it could be a type of love; as in this case; I felt closer to my friend as I supported him throughout the process.
tlove: I would associate love and tenderness in this situation because I believe that I felt so much love toward my friend due to the tenderness I felt.  I was sad for her; but wanted to love her and comfort her even more.
clove: Yes. I would call compassion a type of love.  I felt so much love for Leila because of what she did for me.  I felt so happy and grateful.
slove: I suppose sympathy could be a type of love as I felt sympathetic towards my brother; I also felt bad about what had happened; and it just made me feel more loving towards him.
elove: Empathy; as a love; may be a type of understanding of one another.  It may be a bond because you have experienced the same thing; and thus understand the feelings of someone else.

writepity: When I heard about a friend of a friends father going to jail in 7th grade I felt pity. He went to jail because he was accused of molesting children the same age as his son was at the time. I did not really know the kid and so I was unable to feel any strong attachments to him but when I put myself in his shoes I could not imagine the situation; it felt helpless. I wanted to make it better for him but I knew that was not an option I had because I was not in control in the situation; I was not even part of the situation and so I did and said nothing.
writetende: When I was going into 11th grade and my sister left for college I was upset because it was going to be hard not having her around. Usually she doesn't shoe her emotions but I could tell that she was feeling vulnerable; scared and sad when my mom and I dropped her off. I knew she was going to be okay and that I would adjust as well but I kept thinking about how lonely I would be at home without her and it made me feel closer to her. I wanted to jump forward to a time when her being in college would no longer make me upset; and I had adjusted to the change. I drove home with my mom after dropping her off and was upset for a while and would go into her room but eventually the feeling dissipated.
writecomp: Compassion is a feeling I experienced when a few years ago I saw a homeless man on the street at night who looked cold and hungry. I went into the drug store that he was sitting next to and bought him food; he was very thankful. At the time I felt bad for the man on the street even though I did not know him or his story or how he got to be in the situation he was in. I thought that maybe I could help him a little by buying him food and temporarily relieving his hunger.
writesymp: In school my friend who lives on my floor gets into these times when she becomes incapable of doing her work or cleaning her room or really doing anything productive. When this happened recently I felt bad for her because I know that it is hard for her and so I did what I could to get her out of the slump. I put on music and sat with her while she cleaned her room and tried to get her to start doing her work. However I could not relate to the situation or how she was feeling because it was not something that I had gone through personally. I don't get into slumps where I can't do my work for days like she does and so although I felt bad I was not saddened by the situation.
writeempat: When I found out my friends grandfather died I felt empathy for them. My grandpa had just died recently as well and so I understood what they were going through because I could remember how I felt when my loved one had passed away. I felt horrible because it brought back memories of how I felt when my grandpa first died and It made me upset that my friend now had to go through the same experiences I had to face. I wanted to make the pain disappear for them but I knew that was not a possibility so instead I sat with them and talked until I felt that perhaps I had alleviated their pain.
plove: I would not call pity love. I think you can feel pity without knowing someone and without feeling a particularly strong connection to them. I think pity comes from a place of acknowledging that a situation is bad and you would not want to be in it yourself and therefore feel bad for the person that is in it.
tlove: tenderness is a kind of love that brings people closer together in the face of a shared situation.
clove: Compassion is a fleeting love. It can be experienced briefly but strongly in a situation but does not need to involve actually knowing the person that you have short term love and compassion for.
slove: sympathy is a kind of love that comes from a previously formed connection to someone. You feel sympathy for someone you love when they go through bad situations that you yourself have not had to face.
elove: Empathy is the type of love that comes from understanding and having a previous relationship with the person. Empathy can strengthen love because it connects people through common unfortunate events.

writepity: This past summer; my younger sister who is two years older than me had a very close friend. Her and her close friend did a lot of things together; like cheer on the same high school cheerleading team and hang out with the same group of friends.During the summer; out of no where; this said friend completely stopped talking to my sister. She refused to give my sister any explanation as to why she didn't want to be friends anymore; and was acting completely immature. My sister didn't even care to be friends with this girl anymore; but thought she deserved at least the reason as to why this girl no longer wanted to be friends. After trying to get her friend to talk to her; my sister finally gave up and decided to be the better person; because she knew she would have to deal with this girl at school and during cheer. This girl also happened to be the captain of the cheer team. She acted very immature and unfairly as a captain to a team; taking things out on my sister for no apparent reason. I felt pity for this girl; because she wasn't brought up the right away; and acted very immaturely. I am proud of my sister for how she handled this situation; and can no longer be angry at this girl for how she treated myself but instead feel pity towards her.
writetende: When I was in high school; I started dating one of my sister's friends. He was a year older than me so he went off to college before I did. We decided to stay together during his freshman year in college and my senior year in high school. Although we broke up during a short time during this period; we got back together and were together up until the end of the summer before I went off to college for my freshman year. When I was saying goodbye to him; I felt tenderness towards him; because of the nice things he was saying towards me. Although we weren't staying together; he really told me how much I meant to him in that moment.
writesymp: During the summer before going into my junior year of high school; my dad's best friend had committed suicide. The next morning when I found out; I lost it and couldn't control my emotions. It seemed to be a nightmare that did not actually happen. That day; we went over to his house to go visit his ex wife and his two sons. One of his sons had recently been struggling with drugs. He left his ex wife alone to deal with the situation. I felt extreme sympathy for what she had to go through; because she was also my mom's best friend and someone I had gone very close with ever since I was younger. I felt so bad for her and also for the kids.
plove: I would not call pity a kind of love; because I feel like pity is more of looking down on someone.
pcontempt: No
tlove: Tenderness is the kind of love when you feel so much for that particular person in that moment in time; that every part of you loves them.
slove: I would call sympathy the kind of love where you love the person so much you hate to see them get hurt.

writepity: A time when I felt pity was when my friend got in a car accident and he was telling me about it. It was his fauly because he looked off the road and ran into the back of the car. I felt bad for him because it was a lot of money to fix his car and the other car; but at the same time it was his fault. I was thinking that it was a bad situation that I wouldn't want to be a part of; but there is no one else to blame except himself. I didn't really do much about the situation when he told me; I pretty much told him I'm sorry and that sucks. I felt there really wasn't anything I could do.
writecomp: I felt compassion for my best friend who had just broken up with his girlfriend. They were both leaving for college and decieded to break up once they left. My best friend was heart broken and I constantly had to be there to comfort him and talk it through. I was feeling helpless because I couldn't do anything to change the situation; but I was trying to figure out what it might be like to be in his shoes and knew that he just needed support from his friends. I told him that everything was going to be okay and that he would get over her soon enough. I tried to make him realize that the world wasn't ending but overall I just had to be supportive and listen to him. I wanted to make him feel better but there wasn't anything I could do to change his mood.
writeempat: A time when I felt empathy was when one of my friends didn't get accepted into the college that she wanted to. I knew how it felt to get rejected from colleges and could put myself in her shoes; but this was very tough for her. She was crying and thought that she wouldn't go to any college. I talked to her and told her that she will get into the college where she is meant to go. When I was talking to her I was thinking that she was slightly overreacting but at the same time I realized how hard this was. No one likes rejection and I was feeling lie she just needed to hear that everything was going to be okay. I told her that I had been throuigh the same thing and it helped her. She felt comforted by the fact that she wasn't the only one this happens to.
plove: No I would not call pity a kind of love.
pcontempt: No; I don't think this is true.
clove: I would say at the time it's a temporary love.
elove: I would not call empathy a kind of love.

writesymp: This is not a real participant. Exclude all this subject's data.
slove: test

writepity: One of my best friend's brother has a problem with mental retardation; and therefore cannot control his behavioral actions like any other normal acting person. He often acts loudly and does not have the capacity to behave well in social situations. My friend has a very strong connection and bond with his brother; which allows all of us to feel completely normal around his brother and embrace him with all that we can. I feel pity for him when he used to come to our tennis matches in high school or even out to dinner for our team dinners. He is usually loud and can behave in a childish manner; which other people may not feel comfortable being around. I feel pity for him when I see how others react to his behaviors; mostly due to the fact that I know I cannot change the way other people think about him. I wish more people would be accepting of his actions and be more open to him.
writetende: I honestly cannot think of a specific time in which I felt tenderness toward someone. However; I associate the feeling of tenderness with a situation when I have felt for someone else and tried to do my best to make that person feel better. The feeling of tenderness; for me; comes when I care about how someone else is feeling.
writecomp: My junior year of high school our varsity tennis team was playing in the New England championships against our arch rivals and my brother was the last match on with the score tied 3-3. He was the last match being played; so it was all up to him to win the championship. After he ended up winning his match; our team went on to winning the entire championship.
