writetende: A time I felt tenderness toward someone was when my mom didn't pass her exam the first time. I felt tenderness toward this situation because I love my mom and I hate to see her sad. I remember her coming home and i expected to hear good news but instead it was the opposite. I wanted to cry when she told us but I knew that would make it worse. So instead I gave her a hug and told her she will  pass it next time.
writecomp: A time I felt compassion toward someone was when my brother's phone broke. I felt compassion because I knew how much he loved his phone and I felt bad because I still had my phone but he didn't have his. When I found out that it had happened; I wanted to ask him if he was sad; but instead I told him that he can use my phone whenever he wanted.
writesymp: A time when I felt sympathy toward someone was when my friend received a bad grade on her quiz. It was a quiz in her German class; and she had work very hard on it and I had even helped her study for it. I remember getting out of class and seeing  her in the hallway crying. I felt so bad for her because I knew exactly how she was feeling. When I saw her I wanted to just give her a big hug. I talked to her and told her that the experience should motivate her to do better on the next quiz; and that she just has to work harder next time.
tlove: I would call tenderness a kind of love in which you share a bond with the person.
clove: I would not call compassion a kind of love because people you do not love may receive your compassion.
slove: I would not call sympathy a kind of love because someone can have sympathy for a person they do not love.

writepity: During my freshmen year in college; my friend decided that it was a good idea to bring a water bottle full of hard liquor to go to a party. Later that night; I heard that the cops checked the water bottle and found the alcoholic content. He received an MIP. At this moment; I felt pity towards my friend. It was his fault; and he should not have brought that water bottle with him.
writecomp: One person that I have the strongest relationship in college is my roommate; Chuck. He was from California; and I was from Colorado. We met at a kayak club. I felt comfortable around him and so did he because we were both new to the institution; and we felt out of place. I think we understood each other. Over the next few weeks; we became very close friends; as it turned out that we had a lot in common. We were both premed; and we had many classes together. We helped each other; from schoolwork to other social matters. We became such good friends that we decided to be roommates the next year. I do admit that when we were living together; there were more arguments and disagreements between us than ever before. When hearing about my other friends going through roommate problems; I always compared it to the relationship between me and Chuck. Even though we weren't always totally agreeable; we still got along. At that moment; I knew that he would be a great friend for a long time. That is when I felt a great compassion towards Chuck. As it turns out; we are still roommates; and our friendship has never been stronger.
writesymp: About two years ago; my cousin graduated high school and applied to several different colleges; all being very selective. One thing about my family is that we are all a little greedy and stubborn. We don't like to take mediocrity as an option. My cousin; wanting to go to one of the best colleges in South Korea; had only applied to the prestigious institutions. Unfortunately; he didn't get into any of them. Because he didn't have a safety net school; he wasn't able to go to college that year. It was a rough time for him. He went through depression; and all of us were very concerned about him. I understood what he was going through because I; also didn't get into my top choice college. I understood his pain and frustration. At this moment; I felt a great deal of sympathy towards him.
plove: I don't think pity is associated with love.
pcontempt: I think there is some validation to this saying.
clove: I think compassion is part of love. When I hear compassion; I think of two or more equal people caring for each other. For love to happen; compassion is a necessary component.
slove: I think sympathy can exist in love. When you love someone; and they are going through a tough time; I think it is natural for us to feel sympathy towards that person.

writepity: An experience that I have related to pity is when I was doing a group project in one of my high school classes. There were four of us in the group and we were brainstorming solutions to a problem that we were presented with. As we were discussing solutions everybody was talking and getting to know each other. One of the group mates does not have a great reputation around school and is known as very arrogant; but also very naive. He provided us with a solution that everybody in our group knew was wrong but he was convinced it was correct. We did everything we could to convince him that it was not the correct solution but he did not give in. The more we tried to prove to him that he was on the wrong track; the more he became offended. Instead of creating a rebuttal that was based on fact; he started insulting myself and the other group mates personally. At this time I was frustrated and angry; but also felt a sense of pity towards him because he was embarrassing himself by becoming so offended by our logic.
writetende: A time when I have experienced tenderness is when spending time with my girlfriend. I can remember multiple occasions where having here around and holding her and spending time with her makes you feel warm inside and wanted. Tenderness to me is a feeling that you never want to let go of and it is a feeling that for me is closely associated with love and is a component of love.
writesymp: Everybody knows that commercial when you're sitting on your couch and there is a dog on the screen. Not a healthy; vibrant dog but instead a run-down dog that has clearly been abused or abandoned. The SPCA commercials that beg for adoption and help for those dogs also get my sympathy. Mostly because I am not in a position in my life where I can actually help; but I feel so selfish if I change the channel.
plove: I would NOT call pity a kind of love.
pcontempt: I think this is true because pity is a negative emotion in my opinion and something that is brought on by a negative situation.
tlove: I would certainly call tenderness love. I do not think that it is a kind of love but I think that it is an emotion that is felt when you are in love.
slove: I would say that sympathy is a kind a love and it is a very mild kind of a love.

writepity: A few weeks ago; me and my friends were at a party on the weekend.  One of our friends is very outgoing and laid back around us and strangers as well most of the time; but she gets very nervous and scared when having to initiate a conversation with any guys that she finds attractive.  It has been a big problem for her all year and many a times she feels jealous when the rest of us are flirted with and not her and it has given her real low self-esteem and a negative perception of her body image.  So it was a really big deal for all of us when; at this party; admittedly after a few drinks; she saw a basketball players that shes idolizes and has a huge crush on and actually went up and talked to him.  It was a huge leap for her and they actually stayed talking for close to an hour.  After they split for a little she was so pumped up and confident and we were so happy for her.  She even went right back up to him later that night and asked him to dance; and he said yes.  One of his friends then came over and told him they were leaving but before he walked away; my friend worked up the nerve and asked him for his number.  Once again; a huge leap for her.  He gave it to her and all was great.  We laughed and screamed about it all the way home that night and my friend was ecstatic that she had attained the boy of her dreams.  Her confidence was at an all time high.  So you can imagine how crushed and embarrassed she felt the next day; when she texted the number he gave her and got a text back saying; "sorry; you have the wrong number."  We all felt terrible for her and definitely alot of pity.  We all tried to explain it away with sup-par excuses; like "he probably was just so blackout that he doesn't remember your name and so doesn't think its you texting him" or "his coaches probably bind him in his contracts that he cant just give out his personal number to girls because they could like stalk him"; but inside we all knew the truth and felt helpless.
writetende: I have three dogs and I love very much.  Usually; the love is happy and energetic and light hearted.  But once during a very bad thunderstorm when I was the only one home in my house; my dogs began to cry and become very nervous and frightened by the sound of the thunder.  I corralled them all onto a couch with me and shushed them and stroked them until the calmed down.  They along clung to me and eachother and the soothing sounds of rain and my own hushing created a very poignant mood and as I looked in the eyes of these beautiful and innocent animals that trusted me whole heartedly and found their ultimate comfort in my arms made me feel such strong tenderness for them.
writecomp: In high school; I volunteered at a soup kitchen in NYC one Saturday morning with a few fellow classmates.  The people there were all homeless and at first it made me frightened and guarded because they appeared on the outside very drab and dirty and possibly unsettled in their mind.  Of course; I knew they were all normal people equal to me and after remind myself that it was easy to feel that way but my initial reaction was undeniable.  After about an hour of serving; we were allowed to go around and mingle with the people; ask them about their day; try to cheer them up.  I really never got the hang of it and never felt brave enough to sit down and really engage someone.  But then I saw my friend with an old slightly frightening looking man having a very animated conversation and I worked up the nerve to sit down and join.  This man was so alive and so passionate about life and always staying happy.  He had a very adventurous life and had ended up in his situation for not really one reason or anything he did; it was just his lifestyle and a bit of bad luck that brought him all the way down to this point of poverty.  Although he appeared very unnatural and clearly had a little something off about him; I realized it simply because he had lived more and in a much different way than me and I suddenly respected him so much and felt strong compassion for his life and wanting to help him maintain his happiness and know that we thought he was wonderful.
writesymp: Very recently; my uncle died after a long battle with cancer.  He has an 18 year old son at Cornell and a 16 year old daughter.  They all loved eachother deeply and he was an excellent father and very wise man.  It is a huge loss to our whole family; but I especially feel sharp sympathy for his children.  Both of them have so much going on in their lives and are such good people.  They do not deserve to have their worlds shattered like this at such a young age with such great opportunities at their fingertips which probably now look meaningless and trivial compared to this death.   /
plove: Pity is not a kind of love because things that invoke pity are usually universally seen as deserving pity.  If someone gets cheated on; a stranger and their mother would both feel pity because a fellow human was harmed unrightfully; so its human nature to feel pity about it.  The mother will feel it stronger and with many other emotions accompanying it but that is because she is involved and indirectly effected by the situation; like shes one step back from having grandkids.
pcontempt: It can be.  If one cannot have any personal gain or loss from the other persons situation; then they can have pure pity without contempt.  But say a person gets an ego boost from the other persons pain because they were somehow involved but avoided being embarrassed because they were better in some way; or at least they think they are.  Then it can be more like contempt. /  /
tlove: Tenderness does go hand and hand with love.  it is about staring into someones eyes and not just feeling happy about being with them but feeling like you know so much of them that you are acutally looking at complete truth in their eyes.  You feel like you are the only two people in the whole world and you want it to remain that way.
clove: People usually do not feel compassion for people they love and find to be equal to them.  Compassion has more to do with finding a emotional connection with someone or something that you didnt at first judge that way from the outside. /
slove: Sympathy grows stronger with the respect you hold for that person; which usually increases the more you love someone but it is not love.

writepity: I feel pity for my friend who is in a horrible relationship that she won't get out of. I feel pity for her because she knows how bad of a relationship she is in; but does not have the strength to get out of it. It is pitiful to watch her boyfriend treat her badly and she is pitiful for not standing up for herself and doing something about it. I would describe my feeling as pity towards her because she had put herself in this situation and refuses to get herself out of it.
writetende: I time I felt tenderness toward someone was when my good friend from high school's father passed away the day after New Year's. I was very shaken by the event because her father suddenly passed away one morning at breakfast with her family. There were no warning signs; he simply died. I would say that I felt tenderness towards her because everytime I thought about the situation and what she was going through; it was almost as if my heart literally hurt or was "tender". I found out he had passed away the morning after it had happen and I could shake the feeling of sadness and tenderness all day. I wished that there was something that I could do to lessen the pain that she was experiencing; but there was really nothing I could do. That is another reason that I would say I felt a "tenderness" towards her. When someone is experiencing such a devasting loss there is really nothing that anyone can do for them besides think and feel for them. The thinking and feeling for them is a form of tenderness.
writecomp: I felt compassion when I observed an Occupational Therapist working with a patient who had overcome very many challenges after suffering a debilitating stroke. I felt compassion for the patient because she had to work extremely hard to gain function back in the right side of her body. I would say that I felt compassion for her because there wasn't anything that I could do to help her gain function; but I felt passionately about her strength and determination. I could feel how passionately she wanted to be herself again.
writesymp: I feel sympathy for my friend as he waits to hear back from medical schools. I feel sympathy for him because it is a feeling that I can relate to as I was in the same boat as him when I was waiting to hear back from Occupatoinal Therapy schools. Sympathy is when you can identify with what another person is feeling. The ability to understand another's feeling generally comes from being a similar situation to them. Since you can identify with the person; you can usually tap into those emotions that you once felt to help the person deal with the situation. I make sure to allow my friend to talk with me about the anxiety and stress he feels while waiting to hear back. I feel like allowing him to vent his emotions can alleviate some of the built up stress because while I was waiting to hear back from schools; talking about my feelings helped me.
writeempat: I felt empathy for another patient that I observed at an Occupational Therapy clinic because she had lost function in her wrist. I empathized with her because I had also sprained my wrist once and lost function in it. I felt empathy towards her because I understood what she was feeling and I wanted to motivate her to keep trying to gain function. I didn't want her to give up on her exercises because she wasn't seeing immediate results. The difference between empathy and sympathy is that the feeling of sympathy has an element of sadness to it. The feeling of empathy has some sadness to it; but that sadness is overpowered by knowing you can help.
plove: Pity is not a kind of love.
pcontempt: Yes; I do because you know that person can do something about the situation they are in; but they won't.
tlove: Tenderness would be the kind of love that you feel for your close family and friends.
clove: I would not call compassion a kind of love
slove: I would not call sympathy a kind of love
elove: I would not call empathy a kind of love

writecomp: Three years ago; a very good friend of mine was going through some family trouble and a run-in with the law. I told her that she could stay with my family and me if she needed to get away. She took me up on that offer and stayed with us for a few days. One of the days we were chatting on the bed and she let everything out. She was crying and trying to make sense of what was going on in her life. She felt like everything she knew and had was falling apart. I just listened to her and didn't say anything for a long time. After a while; she calmed down and just laid down; looking up at the ceiling. Then I started to talk to her about life. I told her that even though things were messy in her life; she still has options. Her options may be limited and sometimes difficult; but she can change her life and pursue her dreams. We stayed up late just chatting about general things; but I'd like to think that in some way I had helped.
writesymp: A friend of mine is in the same class as me and we had just taken an exam. The exam was extremely difficult and when we got our exams back; she was clearly upset with the outcome. I did fairly well; but I felt bad that she did not. We had been studying almost everyday together for this exam; but to find out that she didn't do as well; I was sad to see her feeling down. I wanted to comfort. So; I told her we'll study a lot harder for the final and we'll do extremely well.  / Later that night; she texted me to tell me that a grader had miscalculated and shorted her two points. I told her that was great because her grade will go up. Even though I couldn't do anything to change her grade; I could be there to support her and cheer her up.
writeempat: A few months ago; a close friend of mine was going through some hardship (mainly with school) and I wanted to help her get through it. I remembered in my second year of college; I was having a hard time with school work and losing friendships. Although the situation was slightly different; I remember feeling very upset and frustrated; similar to my friend. I told her what was going on in my mind at the time and who was there to support me.  / I wanted to assure her that obstacles and difficult times pass. They aren't permanent fixtures in her life. Because of my past experiences; I was able to discern who was a friend and who pretended to be. Also; I was able to become a stronger person from the difficult times I was confronted with. We talked about what steps I took to making sure that I wouldn't repeat my mistakes and what I could in the future to avoid situations like that.
clove: Loving that person even if they are a total stranger. Showing kindness when there was no reason to.
slove: I wouldn't call sympathy a kind of love per se because it is mostly about trying to cheer up someone you know. Also; you want your mood to be similar to the person you are sympathizing with.
elove: Empathy kind of love is loving that person regardless of what is happening in their lives and understanding that they need someone to support them.

writepity: A girl I know was asking very detailed questions to a facebook group im in (it's the girlfriends of a certain frat's members; closed group) about a recent bonfire that some frat people attended. She basically had trust issues and wanted to know why her boyfriend didnt invite her; how he was acting; how long he stayed. I felt bad for her; and it seemed like questions I'd want to know if my boyfriend did that to me; but id be too embarrassed to ask those semi-publicy! You could tell the other girls when they replied were downplaying whatever situation there was; because you cold tell they felt bad for her too. She later commented confirming the trust issues; and people were supportive of her; but it was embarrassing for her a little bit; to me at least. I talked about it with my friend later and she agreed.
writetende: My boyfriend has panic attacks sometimes. He also is depressed in general; and somewhat paranoid. I am the same way. One time late at night we were both both panicky and sad. We both have our moments of suicidal ideation; and we are both very good at talking each other through our emotions like this. He had had a rough time recently with applying and getting rejected to grad schools; with one of his friends accidentally being killed; it was winter; and he was having problems finding enough money to stay in his fraternity; and finding health insurance to see a therapist. I was also having some issues; and it's usually him taking care of me; and i have to admit that I was used to it being this way. As we talked; he started crying; and having irregular breathing; so I walked him through breathing like we normally do for each other. Then he said he'd been thinking all day of killing himself; and knew he was going to in the future; probably soon. I'd been at work all day; not even thinking about his issues. I could tell that he'd never tell anyone else but me this; and I felt not pity; not only empathy; but the word must be tenderness. I could tell he was in a very vulnerable state; one he does not show to everyone; but felt comfortable letting me know; and trusting me with that information. I had to place my issues aside to deal only with his; even though it's honestly usually the other way around. I knew he didnt want to tell me. He had been trying so hard to live in teh adult world-- grad school; rent; etc for a few months and now I saw him crying and shaking and it was late.
writecomp: I saw a panel of formerly incarcerated women this past weekend; and their stories extended beyond the bland story-line of drugs; arrest; family problems; recuperation. While these steps are all very important and do not get at all as much attention as they should; I could potentially see myself in their situations; and felt the weight of society crushing back against me; knowing if I ever was in their situation; no one would be there to help me; I would be alone. I would not have their spirit and determination to take care of their families while in prison. I would give up and die. They spoke so candidly; I knew what they were saying was honest. I knew I should spend more time advocating for prisoners; especially women; but I knew I could not; since the issue is too large for me to possibly tackle alone.
writesymp: My boyfriend's friend died in a tragic car accident; that happened of absolutely no one's fault. My boyfriend was shaken up by it and didn't talk about it for days; even though I know he needed to and wanted to work through it. I even tried bringing it up in the kindest way possible. I could tell he was down and quiet more often than usual. I didn't know the guy; but still felt sad for everyone involved. No one close to me has ever died so i cant understand exactly what he was going through. I jsut wanted to be there for him and could feel his lower energy.
writeempat: A recent vivid time was when one of my best friend's boyfriend broke up with her after 3 years. They'd been so good together; and were planning on sticking it through when he went to college (she had graduated 2 years before; and he was a senior in high school). They had the best sense of humor together and really seemed to appreciate each other. They had had some bumps in the road as they say; but nothing really major; he just kind of stopped showing her as much care as he used to. She could sense this change but only slightly. One day he finally did it. When she texted me about it; I was relaxing with my boyfriend and immediately felt so sad for her; and sad with her. I began to tear up. I wanted to explain to my boyfriend what had happened but I didn't go into detail; since he didnt know her and it felt like it was too personal to share; and that he wouldn't care enough about it like I did. His anticipated lack of caring made him unsuitable for me to tell. / The storyline of her boyfriend's withdrawl from her was something I had gone through in the past. We had similar experiences of doing nothing wrong; but being withdrawn from and ultimately left by a significant other. She couldn't see a future without him in it; and I had felt the same way before. It made it worse that she was 3 hours away; and I couldn't do anything about it; and I felt a little guilty for being hit with this news while I was over here enjoying my time with my boyfriend.; and guilty that I had a normal day ahead of me while she had a terrible day ahead of her. This event; however; made us better friends; since it encouraged me to call her more often; and now we talk almost every day.
plove: Removed sympathy to a desperate situation
pcontempt: You can't experience pity without having some grip on how someone's life should be; rather than what situation it is in right now. And thinking you know where someone's life *should* be implies you know how to live it better than they do. That's a little contemptuous.
tlove: Caring during vulnerability
clove: Compassion is empathy but directed and with a purpose. Not only to feel for and as another; but it lights a fire to spur future action. You can't feel compassion for someone who is amoral or whose motives were unpure.
sfeltother: 1. the disconnect that I cannot truly understand their emotion / 2. their sadness / 3. general weight of world
slove: An appendage that's extended to others in times of need; but is mainly useless
elove: Connection of shared experiences

writepity: I went a school supported by "Hope Project" in a poor village and I feel pity toward the children there. They don't have enough money to pay for regular school and they don't have enough money to pay for their daily needs. But they really enjoy studying in school and feel optimistic about their life and future; even if they live in poverty. I was moved by their spirits while feeling pity for their poor life. I donated some money and clothes and used textbooks to help these children.
writetende: Last summer when I went back to my hometown and met my best friend when I was in high school. We haven't seen each other for a year so I missed her very much. And I really wanted to express warm and affectionate feeling because I don't need to tell lies and pretend to be someone else when I am with my best friend.
writecomp: Once I took part in a volunteer activities; we visited the home of elderly people. They looked so lonely that I really hope they can have their children with them and taking caring care of them.
writesymp: Each time I see a homeless person; I would have the feeling of sympathy. They have no place to sleep; even in cold snowy winter they have to stay outside.
writeempat: I feel empathy once I read an article in which the writer talked about her own experience.  I felt her experience was so similar to me that I could totally understand.
plove: I would not call it love; but I feel it is more like a sense of responsibility.
pcontempt: I don't think this is true. I don't think pity is contempt. Pity is a kind of impulse to help others which arises from human nature; and when we feel pity towards somebody; we never look down upon them. So I think that's the difference between pity and contempt.
tlove: I would it a kind of love. It would be the kind of magic love that makes others feel warm.
clove: I wouldn't call it a kind of love; because I feel compassion is the kind of feeling that people have in response to others and motive people to help. and it may cause people to  think about themselves sometimes. So I think this is a strong feeling other than a kind of love.
slove: I would call it a kind of love. I think it may be a concern for others.
elove: I would not call it a kind of love; but I think one feel empathy towards others based on their own similar experience and understanding.

writepity: / 1) when I drunk coffee in Starbucks in extreamlly cold day; gorup of homeless started to take seats around me. One of girl;I guess before 30; started to eat the fried chiken that are given by somebody. At that moment; I feel pity. She looks very happy that she founded that is chiken but taste was so so for her; so when she is eating ; she looks like just eating. I was just watching.
writetende: When I did baby sitter for my friend ;the kids is 5 years boy; he asked me to read the book before he slept. So we read and watched the book about anime character and he was excited and I needed to read very long time ;about 90min. And then finally he slept ; when i saw his sleeping face ; I felt tenderness.
writecomp: Checked online to see definition of compassion; and saw that it's the same as sympathy in his language. Experimenter had him skip through this section.
writesymp: / 1) When I did cat sitter in my apartment; the cat was not allowed to come into my bedroom.But he wanted and He tap the door of my bedroom again and again every night. /  / 2) At first; I was angry because he disterbed my sleeping but day by day I am loving him and I feel conflict and feel some sympathy. /  / 3) So last 3 days before he left; I opened the door and to make him free to come in. /  /
plove: sad or look down
pcontempt: No
tlove: Love for soft
slove: Love to give something
